name: Employer-provided paid family and medical leave credit
objective: The baseline tax system would not allow credits for particular activities, investments, or industries. In contrast, current law provides a credit equal to 12.5 to 25 percent of wages paid to qualifying employees while on family and medical leave for up to 12 weeks per year. In order to qualify for the credit, an employer must have a written policy in place that provides at least two weeks of paid family and medical leave per year for full-time workers; additionally, employers must pay at least 50 percent of an employee’s normal wages while they are on paid leave.
categories: Tax Expenditures - Education, Training, Employment, and Social Services
